Articles.Content: The five post thing seems to have been removed for the time, I'm having no trouble posting.

Yeah, mine got deleted..

Sad for my posts and rep points :/
i got deleted too meh sad times indeed

I had some kind of strange luck, my account didn't get deleted but instead reset to it's original name and one post (of something like 100-120). I just hope that I get a second rename under these special circumstances.
Mines gone too I thought I was the only one.
Well my forum account is doing better than the average kerbal in my vessels, it survived!
Lost my profile but YEA! Good to see the forums back!
I got deleted too.
It did suffer some heavy losses, but it survived!
Yup, my account went the way of dodo. I managed to register again early in the morning, but now i have to work again on my post count

Another deleted account here but now IÃ‚Â´m back again.

Luckily I didnÃ‚Â´t loose much (mostly my 5 first posts).
Heh, lucky me.
Mine was saved. :>
Yes me too, only posting to use up these damned moderator checks. Lost a thread I spent ages creating too.. #frustrating

I really hate to say it, as I appreciate the work the staff puts in (as do the rest of us mod makers). But, whoever is responsible for such a blunder, even just to do with a simple backup, honestly deserves to be let go, fired, replaced.

If KSP had not been available for purchase on steam, such a blunder could have cost squad an undetermined but significant amount of money.

Wow the forum thing got me, i was like right there too...

if i made it a month earlier lol

I really hate to say it, as I appreciate the work the staff puts in (as do the rest of us mod makers). But, whoever is responsible for such a blunder, even just to do with a simple backup, honestly deserves to be let go, fired, replaced.

If KSP had not been available for purchase on steam, such a blunder could have cost squad an undetermined but significant amount of money.

Hey, even the larger websites encounter problems and go offline, crash, and loose data. I bet devs have done everything they could to get this issue fixed.

70% of the population got deleted.

Only the elite remains!! Mwahaha!

Just joking. I'm sorry.

Hey, even the larger websites encounter problems and go offline, crash, and loose data. I bet devs have done everything they could to get this issue fixed.

and when that happens, people responsible for such blunders as improper backups, get replaced. just sayin'

My account (EpsilonSigma) wasn't deleted, but its entire history was reduced back to 15 posts. It's beneficial to me really because I now have a new forum account with a screenname created after I joined KSP forums and I don't need to worry about changeover.

Still, it's a little annoying that threads I was watching or had made no longer exist

Oh well, it'll get better I'm sure Squad did everything they could.

See signature. I see a lot of work incoming for the moderators who have to check all the new posts

edit: Oh. They disabled it. Clever.
The crappy part is that it won't let you post anything until you reach a certain post count.

It's a rollback.

Therefore, you did not exist in the time of the rollback.

Not deleted, you just didn't exist.

I was soooo close to being deleted.

Mine didn't, fortunately. However, it did wipe out my avatar...

BRB, fixing that

Yes me too, only posting to use up these damned moderator checks. Lost a thread I spent ages creating too.. #frustrating

I know how you feel. Lost mine too. Was like 8 pages of quality tips from the pros, with builds pics etc.
